definition: two quite different things/two unrelated matters
two/both/some/a few/tael, unit of weight equal to 50 grams (modern) or 1⁄16 of a catty 斤[jin1] (old)
to curve/to return/to revolve
to circle/to go back/to turn around/to answer/to return/to revolve/Hui ethnic group (Chinese Muslims)/time/classifier for acts of a play/section or chapter (of a classic book)
variant of 迴|回[hui2]
matter/thing/item/work/affair/CL:件[jian4],樁|桩[zhuang1],回[hui2]

sentences.english: Keep in mind that polyphasic sleep is not remotely the same as sleep deprivation.
sentences.chinese: 但请记住，多相睡眠和睡眠剥夺是完全两回事。

sentences.english: The knowledge and morality are two different things, not necessarily linked.
sentences.chinese: 而知识和品德是两回事，没有必然联系。

sentences.english: Which is quite a different thing.
The spitting here we are talking is totally different from what we see every day.
sentences.chinese: 这里的吐口水跟我们日常所见的意义完全是两回事。

sentences.english: The word "bandwidth" is sometimes used synonymously with time, but it's really a different thing.
sentences.chinese: “带宽”有时候也与时间同义，但其实是截然两回事。

sentences.english: The obvious point is that correlation is not the same thing as causation.
sentences.chinese: 很明显关联和原因是两回事。

sentences.english: For me there is a big distinction between social networking and social media in general.
sentences.chinese: 对我来说，社交网络与社交媒体根本是两回事。

sentences.english: The real image and the broadcasted picture can be completely different things.
sentences.chinese: 真实的画面与传播的图像可以完全是两回事。

sentences.english: Toilet and cesspool are two different matters, cannot confuse sth with sth else.
sentences.chinese: 厕所与化粪池是两回事，不可混为一谈。

sentences.english: Living in the ivory tower is one thing, making a living in society is another.
sentences.chinese: 象牙塔中的生活与真实的社会是截然不同的两回事。

sentences.english: As you now know, knowing the risk and accepting the risk are two different things.
sentences.chinese: 你清楚，知道和风险和接受风险是两回事。

sentences.english: Well-being and physical well-being are two different things in the skin.
sentences.chinese: 身体安康和皮肤安康是两回事的。

sentences.english: To learn from foreign countries is entirely different from worshipping everything foreign.
sentences.chinese: 学习外国与崇洋媚外完全是两回事。

definition: two quite different things/another kettle of fish
see 沒關係|没关系[mei2 guan1 xi5]
to confuse one thing with another (idiom); to muddle
(old) to report to one's master
to equate/to consider (two things) to be equivalent
to equate/equal to
impossible/cannot/not able
unrelated/having nothing to do (with sth else)
two kinds/difference
lit. as different as sky and earth (idiom)/fig. night and day difference/opposite extremes/a world of difference/a far cry from
different/distinctive/unlike
at a loss/unable to do anything about it/to have no choice
completely
lit. mustn't speak of two things on the same day (idiom); not to be mentioned in the same breath/incomparable
pinyin: bu4 ke3 tong2 ri4 er2 yu3

definition: one thing/the same as
nothing other than/to differ in no way from/the same as/to amount to
